en: I know you are rich.
You can't be hungry. You've just had dinner.
ko: 배고플 리가 없잖아. 방금 저녁 먹었으면서.

en: I hope you'll never turn Communist.
ko: 네가 절대 공산주의자가 안 됐으면 좋겠어.

en: What a lonely world it will be with you away!
Be sure to put out the fire before you leave.
I will not allow you to be ill-treated.
He will be studying when you get up.
ko: 네가 일어날 때쯤 걔는 공부하고 있을 거야.

en: She'll have left before you come back.
ko: 네가 돌아오기 전에 걔는 이미 떠났을 거야.

en: I wish you could drop in at my house on your way home.
ko: 집에 가는 길에 우리 집 좀 들렀다 가면 좋겠다.

en: I'll stay here till you get back.
I will have finished the work before you return.
ko: 네가 돌아오기 전까지 일 다 끝내놓을게.

en: The money you give them will be put to good use.
ko: 네가 준 돈은 좋은 데 쓰일 거야.

en: Thanks to your stupidity, we lost the game.
ko: 네 바보 같은 짓 때문에 경기 졌잖아.

en: It's clear that you're wrong.
I do not for a moment think you are wrong.
ko: 난 네가 틀렸다고 단 한 순간도 생각 안 해.

en: I can't help but think you're making a mistake.
ko: 네가 실수하고 있다는 생각을 지울 수가 없어.

en: If you are wrong, I am wrong too.
ko: 네가 틀린 거면 나도 틀린 거야.

en: You shouldn't have paid the bill.
It is important for you to learn a foreign language.
I'll open the curtain for you to look out.
ko: 밖을 볼 수 있게 커튼 열어줄게.

en: I'm counting on you to join us.
I am counting on you to join us.
It is a pity that you cannot travel with us.
ko: 너랑 같이 여행 못 가서 아쉽다.

en: Hearing you sing, people might take you for a girl.
ko: 네가 노래하는 거 들으면 사람들이 너 여자로 오해할걸.

en: I'll come again when you are free.
ko: 너 시간 날 때 다시 올게.

en: It's no use your saying anything.
Whatever you may say, you won't be believed.
ko: 네가 뭐라고 해도 아무도 안 믿어줄 거야.

en: Say what you will, he won't accept your invitation.
ko: 네가 뭐라고 하든 걔는 네 초대 안 받을 거야.

en: I haven't the faintest idea what you mean.
ko: 네가 무슨 말을 하는지 하나도 모르겠어.

en: It matters little what you do.
I do not mind what you do.
ko: 네가 뭘 하든 난 신경 안 써.

en: Whatever you say, I'll marry her.
ko: 네가 뭐라든 난 걔랑 결혼할 거야.

en: Say what you will, I will act on my own judgement.
ko: 네가 뭐라고 하든 내 판단대로 할 거야.

en: No matter what you say, he still won't do it.
ko: 네가 아무리 말해도 걔는 안 할 거야.

en: Whatever you may say, I don't believe you.
ko: 네가 뭐라든 난 너 안 믿어.

en: It's good to talk things over before you buy something.
ko: 물건 사기 전에 미리 얘기해보는 게 좋아.

en: I wish you were close to me.
It was bad of you to get angry at your wife.
ko: 네 아내한테 화낸 건 네가 잘못한 거야.

en: Your refusal to help complicated matters.
ko: 네가 안 도와준다고 해서 일이 꼬였어.

en: I can no more speak French than you can speak English.
ko: 네가 영어 못하는 것처럼 나도 프랑스어 못해.

en: What is the main purpose of your studying English?
ko: 네가 영어 공부하는 주된 이유가 뭐야?

en: If you could only speak English, you would be perfect.
ko: 너 영어만 할 줄 알면 완벽할 텐데.

en: It's evident that you told a lie.
ko: 네가 거짓말한 거 다 티 나.

en: What is that thing in your right hand?
Would you mind making an extra cup of coffee whenever you decide to have some?
ko: 커피 마실 때 내 것도 한 잔만 타줄래?

en: It seems as if you are the first one here.
ko: 네가 제일 먼저 온 것 같네.

en: It is risky for you to go into that area alone.
ko: 저 동네에 너 혼자 가는 건 위험해.

en: I enjoyed the holiday all the better for being with you.
ko: 너랑 같이 있어서 휴가가 훨씬 더 즐거웠어.

en: As long as you stick to one style, you can't hit upon a wonderful idea.
ko: 한 가지 스타일만 고집하면 좋은 아이디어가 안 떠오를 거야.

en: You are to blame.
You are not to blame, nor is he.
ko: 네 잘못도 아니고, 그 사람 잘못도 아니야.

en: It is plain that you are to blame.
You need not take the trouble to go there.
You're going to leave for London next Sunday, aren't you?
ko: 다음 주 일요일에 런던으로 떠나는 거지, 그렇지?

en: It is because you are lazy that you cannot write your report.
ko: 네가 게을러서 보고서를 못 쓰는 거야.

en: I will come on Monday unless you write to the contrary.
I was about to leave when you telephoned.
ko: 너한테 전화 왔을 때 막 나가려던 참이었어.

en: I'm looking forward to hearing from you.
You go first.
I heard it from you.
I stayed home last night to be able to receive your call.
ko: 너 전화 받으려고 어제저녁에 집에 있었어.

en: I didn't expect such a nice present from you.
ko: 너한테 이렇게 좋은 선물을 받을 줄은 몰랐어.

en: You can do whatever you want to.
ko: 네가 하고 싶은 대로 다 해.

en: It was silly of you to trust them.
ko: 그 사람들을 믿다니 너도 참 바보 같았어.

en: I would do it in a different way than you did.
What you've done is profitable only to the enemy.
ko: 네가 한 짓은 적들 좋은 일만 시킨 꼴이야.

en: In terms of the pay you will get, is this a good job?
If you were to fall from that bridge, it would be almost impossible to rescue you.
ko: 그 다리에서 떨어지면 널 구하는 건 거의 불가능할 거야.

en: If you ask him again, he may change his mind.
ko: 그 사람한테 다시 부탁해 보면 마음을 바꿀지도 몰라.

en: No harm will come to you.
I think it's wonderful that you're going on a picnic.
Is it true that you are going to Paris?
I am not any more foolish than you are.
The shoes you are wearing look rather expensive.
ko: 네가 신고 있는 신발 꽤 비싸 보인다.

en: I will see to it that you meet her at the party.
ko: 파티에서 그녀를 만날 수 있게 내가 알아서 할게.

en: Say what you will, I think he is an honest person.
ko: 누가 뭐래도 난 그 사람이 정직한 사람이라고 생각해.

en: I will help him no matter what you say.
ko: 네가 뭐라고 하든 난 그를 도울 거야.

en: Say what you will; I won't change my mind.
ko: 네가 뭐라고 해도 내 마음은 안 변해.

en: I marvel how you could agree to the proposal.
ko: 네가 어떻게 그 제안에 찬성했는지 놀라워.

en: It is obvious why you have a stomach-ache.
I can imagine how you felt.
However fast you may walk, you can't catch up with him.
ko: 네가 아무리 빨리 걸어도 그 사람을 따라잡을 순 없어.

en: Try as you may, you will not be able to read as many as five novels in a day.
ko: 아무리 애를 써도 하루에 소설을 다섯 권이나 읽을 수는 없을 거야.

en: Try to estimate how much you spent on books.
ko: 책 사는 데 돈을 얼마나 썼는지 한번 계산해 봐.

en: I have a good mind to strike you for being so rude.
ko: 너 너무 무례해서 한 대 때려주고 싶다.

en: No matter where you may go, don't forget to write to me.
ko: 어디에 가든 나한테 편지하는 거 잊지 마.

en: I must go there irrespective of what you think.
ko: 네가 어떻게 생각하든 난 거기 가야겠어.

en: You should have nothing to complain about.
ko: 넌 불평할 게 하나도 없어야 해.

en: No wonder you could not open the door.
What is it that makes you think that way?
I'm surprised at your behavior.
It's strange you say that.
I will do my best to put such an idea out of your head.
ko: 네 머릿속에서 그런 생각을 지워버릴 수 있게 최선을 다해볼게.

en: How can I feel relaxed, with you watching me like that?
ko: 네가 그렇게 쳐다보는데 어떻게 마음이 편하겠어?

en: I can't abide hearing you cry so bitterly.
ko: 네가 그렇게 서럽게 우는 걸 듣고 있을 수가 없어.

en: It is outrageous that you should spend so much money.
ko: 네가 그렇게 큰돈을 쓰다니 말도 안 돼.

en: It is a pity that you should lose such a chance.
It is foolish of you to believe such a thing.
ko: 그런 걸 믿다니 참 바보 같아.

en: It's absurd of you to do that.
It is absurd of you to do that.
It is no use your trying to deny it.
It is a great pity that you don't know it.
It makes no difference to me whether you believe it or not.
It makes little difference to me whether you believe it or not.
ko: 네가 믿든 안 믿든 나한텐 별 차이 없어.

en: It is right that you should write it.
The day will come when you will realize it.
ko: 네가 그걸 깨닫게 될 날이 올 거야.

en: The time will come when you'll regret it.
I'm glad you liked it.
You are mad to try to do it all alone.
ko: 그걸 혼자 다 하려 하다니 너 제정신 아니야.

en: I wish you had not told the story to my mother.
ko: 우리 엄마한테 그 얘기 안 했으면 좋았을 텐데.

en: When was it that you visited the museum?
It is no wonder that you are turning down the proposal.
ko: 네가 그 제안을 거절하는 건 당연해.

en: What made it difficult for you to carry out the plan?
It is absolutely necessary that you be at the meeting.
You have no good reason for thinking as you do.
ko: 그렇게 생각하는 데 별다른 이유도 없잖아.

en: I cannot believe you did not see him then.
ko: 그때 걔를 못 봤다니 믿을 수가 없어.

en: Ten to one you can pass the test.
The time will come when you will be sorry for it.
ko: 그걸 후회하게 될 날이 올 거야.

en: I'll do it, if you insist.
I can't work with you standing there.
ko: 너 거기 서 있으면 나 일 못 해.

en: By the time you got there, the sun had set.
ko: 네가 거기 도착했을 때쯤엔 이미 해가 져 있었어.

en: You gave me a real surprise when you showed up there.
ko: 네가 거기 나타났을 때 정말 깜짝 놀랐어.

en: Since you say so.
You may well say so, but I cannot agree.
ko: 네가 그렇게 말하는 것도 무리는 아니지만, 난 동의 못 해.

en: There is no reason why you shouldn't do such a thing.
ko: 네가 그런 일을 하지 말아야 할 이유는 없어.

en: I don't blame you.
I can't allow you to do that.
There are a good many reasons why you shouldn't do it.
ko: 네가 그걸 하면 안 되는 이유는 아주 많아.

en: I don't blame you for doing that.
ko: 네가 그렇게 했다고 해서 널 탓하진 않아.

en: We will pay you according to the amount of work you do.
ko: 네가 일한 양에 맞춰서 돈 줄게.

en: I'm glad you enjoy skiing, but I guess it's just not my cup of tea.
ko: 네가 스키를 즐긴다니 다행인데, 나랑은 좀 안 맞는 것 같아.

en: I'll do everything you tell me to do.
ko: 네가 시키는 건 뭐든 다 할게.

en: Your conduct is absolutely shameful.
I cannot see you behaving like that.
ko: 네가 그렇게 행동하는 건 못 봐주겠어.

en: I didn't expect you to get here so soon.
It was too bad you couldn't come.
It's a pity that you couldn't come.
It is easy for you to solve this problem.
You wrote this book?
I didn't know that you were in this town.
ko: 네가 이 동네에 있는 줄 몰랐어.

en: It is dangerous for you to swim in this river.
It is out of the question for you to go to New York this weekend.
ko: 이번 주말에 네가 뉴욕에 가는 건 말도 안 돼.

en: It is very difficult for you to do this work.
ko: 네가 이 일을 하는 건 아주 힘들어.

en: The time will come when you will understand this.
ko: 이걸 이해하게 될 때가 올 거야.

en: Where was it that you found this key?
I didn't expect you to turn up here.
There is no need for you to stay here.
As long as you're here, I'll stay.
ko: 네가 여기 있는 한 나도 있을게.

en: With you here beside me I'm not afraid of anything. You're my fortress.
ko: 네가 내 곁에 있으면 난 아무것도 두렵지 않아. 넌 나의 요새야.

en: The watch you gave me doesn't keep time.
ko: 니가 준 시계 시간이 안 맞아.

en: I had no notion that you were coming.
My life would be completely empty without you.
ko: 너 없으면 내 인생은 정말 텅 빈 거 같을 거야.

en: You'll be missed by your friends.
We shall all miss you when you go away.
ko: 너 가면 우리 다 너 보고 싶을 거야.

en: I miss you badly.
How I miss you.
I miss you very much.
We all miss you very much.
ko: 우리 모두 너 정말 많이 보고 싶어.

en: We will miss you badly.
ko: 우리 너 진짜 많이 보고 싶을 거야.

en: Whenever you come, I'm ready.
It is because you work too much that you are sleepy all the time.
ko: 니가 일을 너무 많이 해서 맨날 졸린 거야.

en: Why is it that you are always late?
You may stay here as long as you like.
ko: 있고 싶은 만큼 여기 있어도 돼.

en: You can talk until you're blue in the face, but you'll never convince me.
ko: 입 아프게 말해봐야 날 설득하진 못할걸.

en: Laugh as much as you like; I'll stick to my plan to the bitter end.
ko: 비웃고 싶으면 맘대로 해. 난 끝까지 내 계획대로 할 거니까.

en: I cannot endure your going.
You walk too fast for me to keep up with you.
ko: 니가 너무 빨리 걸어서 못 따라가겠어.

en: If only you had told me the whole story at that time!
ko: 그때 사실대로 다 말해줬더라면 좋았을 텐데!

en: It is impossible for you to jump two meters high.
We think it is very dangerous that you're climbing the mountain alone.
ko: 너 혼자 등산하는 건 너무 위험하다고 생각해.

en: Here is a letter for you.
Are you saying that our plan was accepted? I hope you're not showing me any premature happiness here.
ko: 우리 계획이 통과됐다고? 김칫국부터 마시는 거 아니었으면 좋겠네.

en: You, be quiet!
Have you ever seen Mt. Fuji? It is beautiful beyond description.
ko: 후지산 본 적 있어? 말로 표현할 수 없을 정도로 아름다워.

en: You've filled out.
What time will you leave?
You don't understand.
You can do this with ease.
ko: 넌 이거 쉽게 할 수 있어.

en: You come here.
Repetition helps you remember something.
Chestnuts have to be boiled for at least fifteen minutes.
A bear will not touch a dead body.
ko: 곰은 죽은 몸에는 손 안 대.

en: A bear can climb a tree.
The bear left no stone unturned in his search for fat bugs under the rocks.
ko: 곰은 바위 밑에 있는 통통한 벌레를 찾으려고 샅샅이 뒤졌어.

en: Bears also tend to sleep more during the day than at night, although in the summer, with twenty-four hours of light, this does not apply.
ko: 곰은 밤보다 낮에 더 많이 자는 편인데, 해가 지지 않는 여름에는 예외야.

en: How long does a bear sleep?
The bear began tearing at the tent.
When bears sleep or lie down, their postures depend on whether they want to get rid of heat or conserve it.
ko: 곰이 자거나 누울 때 자세는 열을 식히고 싶은지 아니면 유지하고 싶은지에 따라 달라져.

en: No one noticed the bear's appearance.
ko: 곰이 나타난 걸 아무도 눈치채지 못했어.

en: Take off your socks, please.
Stockings should be of the proper size.
Are my socks dry already?
There is a hole in your sock.
There are fashions for socks as well.
Put on your shoes. Let's go out for dinner.
Please put on your shoes.
Put on your shoes.
Before buying shoes, you should try them on.
ko: 신발 사기 전에는 꼭 신어봐야 해.

en: Take off your shoes.
Please take off your shoes.
Please remove your shoes before entering the house.
ko: 집에 들어가기 전에 신발 좀 벗어 주세요.

en: I bought a pair of shoes.
Give my shoes a good shine.
The shoelace came untied.
Your shoes need brushing. They are muddy.
Shoes are stiff when they are new.
Shoes are sold in pairs.
Where're the shoes?
You must keep your shoes clean.
How soon can I have my shoes mended?
ko: 신발 수선 맡기면 언제쯤 다 될까요?

en: Tie your shoelaces.
Gum got stuck to the bottom of my shoe.
The soles of my shoes are worn.
Brush off the dust from your shoes.
What size shoes do you wear?
My shoes hurt. I'm in agony.
Your feet are swollen because your shoes are too small.
Please remove the mud from your shoes.
ko: 신발에 묻은 진흙 좀 닦아 주세요.

en: I'd like some shoes.
My shoes are worn out.
The shoes are worn out.
These shoes are too tight. They hurt.
ko: 이 신발은 너무 꽉 껴서 아파요.

en: It's a catch.
I would rather die than live in dishonor.
ko: 치욕스럽게 사느니 차라리 죽는 게 낫겠어요.

en: The Sumida is not a good river for us to swim in any more.
ko: 스미다 강은 이제 수영하기에 좋은 곳이 아니에요.

en: Could we have a table in the corner?
Don't leave it up to chance.
The man in the corner addressed himself to the husband.
ko: 구석에 있던 남자가 남편에게 말을 걸었어요.

en: I met her by accident.
By chance we saw him as he came out of the shop.
It just so happened that Mr Yamada came from the same town.
ko: 마침 야마다 씨가 같은 고향 사람이더라고요.

en: It is true that he did it, whether by accident or by design.
ko: 고의든 아니든 그가 그 일을 한 건 사실이에요.

en: What a coincidence!
I just came up with the word.
I found the book by accident.
I found that restaurant by accident.
I met her by chance.
I happened to witness the bullying in the corridor.
By chance, I met her in the street.
By chance I met my ex-girlfriend in Portugal.
It happened that I saw my friend walking in the distance.
ko: 멀리서 친구가 걸어오는 걸 우연히 봤어요.

en: Even times odd is even, odd times odd is odd.
ko: 짝수 곱하기 홀수는 짝수고, 홀수 곱하기 홀수는 홀수예요.

en: The sky promises fair weather.
The sky looks angry.
Judging from the look of the sky, it will be fine tomorrow.
Judging from the look of the sky, it may rain at any moment.
ko: 하늘을 보니까 금방이라도 비가 올 것 같아요.

en: Judging from the look of the sky, we may have snow tomorrow.
ko: 하늘을 보니까 내일 눈이 올 것 같아요.

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it is going to snow.
Judging from the look of the sky, it may rain this afternoon.
ko: 하늘을 보니까 오늘 오후에 비가 올 것 같아요.

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it will clear up in the afternoon.

en: I felt hungry.

ko: 굶주림으로 고통받는 나라들이 있는데도 일본의 많은 가정과 식당에서 음식이 버려지고 있다는 건 부끄러운 일이에요.

en: Hungry and thirsty, we at last reached the inn.

en: With the power of imagination, we can even travel through space.

en: Are seats available?

ko: 공기 중의 미세 먼지는 암을 유발할 수 있어요.

en: Air is a mixture of gases that we cannot see.

ko: 땀 흘리지 않고 얻는 건 없어.

ko: 은행은 맑은 날엔 우산을 빌려주려 하지만, 비 오는 날엔 외면하곤 하죠.

en: You'll find the shop between a bank and a school.
ko: 그 가게는 은행이랑 학교 사이에 있어요.

en: He works for a bank.
I have to withdraw some cash from the bank.
Please draw a hundred thousand yen from the bank.
A banking scandal is sweeping across Capitol Hill.
ko: 은행 비리 스캔들이 국회를 휩쓸고 있어요.

en: How do you expect to weather the financial storm when the bank refuses to extend a helping hand?
ko: 은행이 도와주지 않는데 이 금융 위기를 어떻게 이겨낼 생각이세요?

en: I have to take some money out of the bank.
Do you have any idea when the bank closes?
There are innumerable stars in the galaxy.
Can you distinguish silver from tin?
It is difficult to peg the direction of interest deregulation.
ko: 금리 자유화가 어느 방향으로 갈지 예측하기 어렵네요.

en: Bank lending is rising because of lower interest rates.
ko: 금리가 낮아져서 은행 대출이 늘고 있어요.

en: Falling interest rates have stimulated the automobile market.
Six percent home loans represent the industry average now.
ko: 주택 담보 대출 금리는 현재 6%가 평균이에요.

en: I'm tied up with a project that is due Friday.
ko: 금요일까지 끝내야 하는 프로젝트 때문에 정신이 없어요.

en: Be sure to telephone by Friday, OK?
I need to know your answer by Friday.
Can you manage to complete the manuscript by Friday?
ko: 금요일까지 원고를 다 마칠 수 있겠어요?

en: He said he would give us his decision for sure by Friday.
ko: 그가 금요일까지는 확실히 결정을 내려주겠다고 했어요.

en: Friday is the day when she is very busy.
Friday is when I am least busy.
ko: 금요일이 제가 제일 안 바쁜 날이에요.

en: Read chapter 4 for Friday.
On Friday night, three men came into Mr White's hotel and asked for rooms.
ko: 금요일 밤에 남자 세 명이 화이트 씨의 호텔에 와서 방을 달라고 했어요.

en: There will be a dance Friday night at the high school.
ko: 금요일 밤에 고등학교에서 댄스 파티가 열려요.

en: There were no tickets available for Friday's performance.
Are you free on Friday afternoon?
The bank shuts late on Fridays.
We can hardly wait for the party on Friday.
We're going out for a meal on Friday.
When Friday comes around, it's time for me to let my hair down and enjoy the weekend.
ko: 금요일이 되면 긴장을 풀고 주말을 즐길 시간이죠.

en: A dance will be held on Friday.
Is there a table available for two on Friday?
A fiscal tightening policy is being enacted.
Interest rates will rise due to monetary tightening.
ko: 긴축 통화 때문에 금리가 오를 거예요.

en: Costs of financial services are rising in every country.
ko: 나라마다 금융 서비스 비용이 오르고 있어요.

en: The Golden Gate Bridge is made of iron.
How long is the Golden Gate Bridge?
He will do anything to make money.
ko: 그 사람은 돈을 벌기 위해서라면 뭐든 할 거예요.

en: To make money is not the purpose of life.
ko: 돈을 버는 게 인생의 목적은 아니에요.

en: Apart from earning money, I have no interest in real estate.
ko: 돈 버는 거 말고는 부동산에 관심 없어요.

en: We ran short of money.
A blonde is speaking to her psychiatrist.
ko: 금발 여성이 정신과 의사랑 상담하고 있어요.

en: A girl with blonde hair came to see you.
Kanazawa is a quiet city.
There are sometimes blizzards in Kanazawa.
Metal contracts when cooled.
The acid burned the metal.
Love of money is common to all men.
ko: 돈을 좋아하는 건 누구에게나 공통된 일이에요.

en: I think the love of money is common to us all.
ko: 돈을 밝히는 건 우리 모두에게 공통적인 것 같아요.

en: We should not place too much emphasis on money.
ko: 돈에 너무 큰 비중을 두면 안 돼요.

en: Money is not a criterion of success.
Money is the measure of worth.
Money is the root of all evil.
My financial worries are past.
Take part in the activity not for money but for learning through experience.
ko: 돈 때문이 아니라 경험을 쌓으려고 그 활동에 참여해 보세요.

en: I had a quarrel with him over money.
Give me your money.
There are many things which we cannot evaluate in terms of money.
ko: 돈으로 환산할 수 없는 게 참 많아요.

en: The rich have trouble as well as the poor.
The rich are apt to look down upon the poor.
The rich are not always happy.
ko: 부자라고 해서 항상 행복한 건 아니에요.

en: The rich are apt to look down on people.
The rich sometimes despise the poor.
The rich are often misers.
The rich merchant adopted the boy and made him his heir.
ko: 그 부유한 상인이 소년을 입양해서 후계자로 삼았어요.

en: The rich have troubles as well as the poor.
ko: 부자들도 가난한 사람들처럼 나름의 고충이 있어요.

en: For all his wealth, he is unhappy.
If I get rich, I will buy it.
Some people identify success with having much money.
ko: 어떤 사람들은 돈이 많은 걸 성공이라고 생각해요.

en: I prefer being poor to being rich.
ko: 전 부자가 되는 것보다 가난한 게 더 나아요.

en: The richer he became, the more he wanted.
ko: 그는 부자가 될수록 욕심이 더 많아졌어요.

en: He became rich.
Do you want to be rich?
Though she is rich, she is not happy.
Were I rich, I would help the poor.
ko: 제가 부자라면 가난한 사람들을 도울 텐데 말이죠.

en: I wish I were rich.
Few rich men own their own property.
ko: 자기 재산을 온전히 소유한 부자는 거의 없어요.

en: He is rich yet he lives like a beggar.
For all his wealth, he is not contented.
ko: 재산이 그렇게 많은데도 그는 만족할 줄 몰라요.

en: Rich as he is, he is not happy.
Just because a man is rich it does not necessarily follow that he is happy.
ko: 부자라고 해서 반드시 행복한 건 아니에요.

en: We see things differently according to whether we are rich or poor.
ko: 부자냐 가난하냐에 따라 세상을 보는 게 달라.

en: The rich are not always happier than the poor.
ko: 부자라고 가난한 사람보다 항상 더 행복한 건 아니야.

en: He may be rich, but he is stingy.
ko: 걔 돈은 많을지 몰라도 진짜 구두쇠야.

en: The papers that were in the safe are gone.
I put money in a safe.
Lock the safe.
I'm broke.
I'm feeding the goldfish.
Regardless of the amount, Brian wants the correct, entire amount by next week.
ko: 금액이 얼마든 간에 브라이언은 다음 주까지 전액을 정확히 다 받길 원해.

en: The gold coin was much more valuable than was supposed.
ko: 그 금화는 생각했던 것보다 훨씬 더 가치 있는 거였어.

en: There is a gold coin.
I had to resort to threats to get my money back.
Many men went west in search of gold.
ko: 많은 사람들이 금을 찾아서 서쪽으로 갔어.

en: Lend your money and lose your friend.
ko: 친구한테 돈 빌려주면 친구까지 잃는 법이야.

en: I should have taken the money.
ko: 그냥 그 돈 받을 걸 그랬어.

en: He who pays the piper calls the tune.
Get out your wallet.
I don't want to lend or borrow.
ko: 난 돈 빌려주는 것도 빌리는 것도 싫어.

en: Lend me some money, if you have any.
It is foolish to equate money with happiness.
ko: 돈이랑 행복을 똑같이 생각하는 건 바보 같은 짓이야.

en: I will do it on condition that I am paid.
We die whether we make money or not.
ko: 돈을 벌든 못 벌든 사람은 어차피 죽어.

en: The loss of money made it impossible for him to go abroad.
ko: 돈을 잃는 바람에 걔는 외국에 못 가게 됐어.

en: It's money down the drain.
We must cut our expenses to save money.
Some people look down on others because they have less money.
ko: 돈이 없다고 사람을 무시하는 사람들이 있어.

en: Don't ask for money.
Making money is his religion.
ko: 걔는 돈 버는 걸 종교처럼 여겨.

en: Health is better than wealth.
I prefer silver rings to gold ones.
No money, no job, no friends. He was truly at loose ends.
ko: 돈도 없고, 직업도 없고, 친구도 없고. 걔는 정말 갈 곳 없는 신세였어.

en: Money does not grow on trees.
ko: 돈이 땅 파서 나오는 게 아니잖아.

en: I will give you the money tomorrow.
Money will make the pot boil.
ko: 돈이 있으면 어떻게든 살게 돼 있어.

en: Money comes and goes.
Gold is heavier than iron.
Gold is more precious than iron.
The gold was beaten into thin plates.
Money ruins many.
Money is a good servant, but a bad master.
ko: 돈은 부리기엔 좋지만, 상전으로 모시기엔 최악이야.

en: Gold is far heavier than water.
The money was hidden beneath the floorboards.
Gold is similar in color to brass.
I have little money.
I have a little money.
Was the money actually paid?
Ready money will away.
ko: 수중에 있는 돈은 금방 써버리게 돼.

en: Gold is heavier than silver.
Keep the money in a safe place.
I have no money, but I have dreams.
Poor as he is, he is generous.
ko: 가난하긴 해도 걘 참 마음이 넉넉해.

en: Money is welcome everywhere.
There is a lot of money.
I have some money with me.
I wouldn't like to be in his position, for all his wealth.
ko: 돈이 아무리 많아도 걔 처지가 되고 싶진 않아.

en: Gold is more precious than any other metal.
ko: 금은 다른 어떤 금속보다 더 귀해.

en: Don't kill the goose that lays the golden eggs.
ko: 황금 알을 낳는 거위의 배를 가르지 마.

en: I feel the want of money.
The price of gold varies from day to day.
The end of money is the end of love.
I have no money on me.
ko: 나 지금 가진 돈이 하나도 없어.

en: As soon as there is any talk of paying, he cools down.
ko: 돈 내란 소리만 나오면 걔는 싹 식어버려.

en: The price of gold fluctuates daily.
It is certain that the price of gold will go up.
We had a bar of gold stolen.
Money doesn't grow on trees, you know.
I am short of money.
Send me the best employees that money can buy. Money is no object.
ko: 돈은 얼마든지 줄 테니까 최고로 유능한 사람들로 보내줘. 돈은 상관없으니까.

en: I'm not pressed for money.
Money is the last thing he wants.
ko: 걔는 돈 같은 건 전혀 관심 없어.

en: Money and I are strangers; in other words, I am poor.
ko: 나랑 돈은 거리가 멀어. 한마디로 가난하다는 거지.

en: Power and money are inseparable.
ko: 권력이랑 돈은 뗄 수 없는 관계야.

en: Money cannot compensate for life.
Money soon goes.
Money cannot buy happiness.
Money cannot buy freedom.
It goes without saying that money cannot buy happiness.
ko: 돈으로 행복을 살 수 없다는 건 말할 필요도 없지.

en: Money can't buy happiness.
Gold will not buy everything.
ko: 금으로 모든 걸 살 순 없어.

en: In this harsh, petty world where money does the talking, his way of life is like a breath of fresh air.
ko: 돈이 전부인 이 삭막하고 치사한 세상에서 걔가 사는 방식은 정말 신선해.

en: Too much money?
He is rolling in riches.
It seems like there's no money left.
Money talks.
Little money, few friends.
Money is not everything.
Some of the money was stolen.
If I had money, I would pay what I owe you. As it is, I can't pay.
ko: 돈만 있으면 갚을 텐데, 지금은 그럴 형편이 안 돼.

en: Money enables you to buy anything.
ko: 돈만 있으면 뭐든 살 수 있어.

en: If I were rich, I would do so. As it is, I can do nothing.
ko: 내가 부자라면 그렇게 하겠지만, 지금은 할 수 있는 게 없어.

en: The neighboring countries never submitted to his terrorism.
ko: 이웃 나라들은 그의 테러에 절대 굴복하지 않았어.

en: Prices have been gradually rising in recent years.
ko: 최근 몇 년 사이에 물가가 서서히 오르고 있어.

en: In recent years, they have often moved.
ko: 요 몇 년 동안 걔네 이사 자주 다녔어.

en: Many local traditions have fallen into decay in recent years.
ko: 최근 몇 년간 많은 지역 전통들이 사라져가고 있어.

en: In recent years, science has made remarkable progress.
Modern travel enables us to go around the world in a few days.
ko: 요즘은 여행 기술이 좋아서 며칠이면 세계 일주도 가능해.

en: Recent advances in medicine are remarkable.
In recent years electronic computers have become increasingly important.
ko: 최근 들어 컴퓨터의 중요성이 점점 더 커지고 있어.

en: Chemistry has made notable progress in recent years.
ko: 최근 몇 년 사이 화학 분야가 눈에 띄게 발전했어.

en: We will have some visitors one of these days.
ko: 조만간 손님들이 몇 분 오실 거야.

en: I will be seeing her again one of these days.
ko: 조만간 그 사람 다시 보게 될 거예요.

en: We are going to make up for lost time by taking a short cut.
Let's take a short cut.
Mr Kondo is the most hardworking in his company.
ko: 콘도 씨는 자기 회사에서 제일 부지런해요.

en: Modern methods improved industry.
The lack of modern post facilities caused trouble for many shippers.
ko: 현대적인 우편 시설이 부족해서 많은 운송업자들이 어려움을 겪었어요.

en: The art of modern warfare does not necessarily require soldiers to be armed to the teeth to be effective as combatants.
ko: 현대 전술에서는 군인이 꼭 중무장을 해야만 효과적으로 싸울 수 있는 건 아니에요.

en: Among modern novels, this is the best.
Why didn't modern technology develop in China?
ko: 중국에서는 왜 현대 기술이 발전하지 않았을까요?

en: The advancement of modern medicine was a long process.
ko: 현대 의학의 발전은 아주 긴 과정이었어요.

en: The whole neighborhood was surprised at the news.
ko: 그 소식에 온 동네 사람들이 깜짝 놀랐어요.

en: His neighbors are suspicious of him.
My neighbors provided food for me.
ko: 이웃들이 저한테 먹을 걸 좀 갖다줬어요.

en: The whole neighborhood mourned his death.
ko: 온 동네 사람들이 그의 죽음을 애도했어요.

en: The neighbors took turns sitting up with him.
You must be friendly with your neighbors.
The neighbors made a fool of him.
Before saying goodbye to their neighbors, the Smiths had to tie up some loose ends inside the house.
ko: 이웃들에게 작별 인사를 하기 전에 스미스 씨 부부는 집안의 남은 일들을 좀 마무리해야 했어요.

en: Our American neighbor will have lived in Japan for five years next year.
ko: 옆집에 사는 미국인은 내년이면 일본에서 산 지 5년째가 돼요.

en: There was a big fire in my neighborhood.
The farmer that lived nearby came to investigate.
ko: 근처에 살던 농부가 무슨 일인지 보러 왔어요.

en: I'm a regular at a restaurant in this neighborhood. Let's have lunch there today.
ko: 이 동네에 제 단골집이 있는데, 오늘 거기서 점심 먹어요.

en: A fire broke out near my house.
Have you met the new family on the block?
ko: 새로 이사 온 이웃 가족 보셨어요?

en: There are a handful of naughty boys in my neighborhood.
ko: 우리 동네에 장난꾸러기 애들이 몇 명 있어요.

en: A fire broke out in the neighborhood yesterday.
There has been another case of cholera in the neighborhood.
I haven't slept well recently.
I have seen little of him of late.
I have seen much of him lately.
The number of Japanese students returning after life abroad has been increasing as of late.
ko: 최근 들어 유학 갔다가 돌아오는 일본 학생 수가 늘고 있어요.

en: Young people wear their hair long these days.
ko: 요즘 젊은 사람들은 머리를 길게 기르네요.

en: The sudden increase of cars is causing a large number of traffic accidents every day.
ko: 차가 갑자기 늘어나서 매일 교통사고가 많이 나고 있어요.

en: Nowadays we are apt to forget the benefits of nature.
ko: 요즘 우리는 자연의 혜택을 잊고 살기 쉬워요.

en: Beef is expensive nowadays.
These days more and more people are traveling abroad.
ko: 요즘 해외 여행 가는 사람들이 점점 늘어나고 있어요.

en: Travelling is easy these days.
The recent frequency of earthquakes makes us nervous.
Honesty seems to be rather at a discount today.
ko: 요즘은 정직함이 대우받지 못하는 것 같아요.

en: Nowadays jobs are hard to come by.
Few people visit me these days.
ko: 요즘은 저를 찾아오는 사람이 거의 없어요.

en: Many young Japanese travel overseas these days.
ko: 요즘 일본 젊은이들은 해외 여행을 많이 가요.

en: Business is so slow these days.
Good lumber is hard to find these days.
Many shoes nowadays are made of plastics.
How are you these days?
How are you getting along these days?
That young critic is in high demand for a lot of places.
ko: 그 젊은 비평가는 여기저기서 찾는 데가 정말 많아요.

en: It is not rare for girls today to talk as if they were boys.
ko: 요즘 여자애들이 남자애들처럼 말하는 건 흔한 일이에요.

en: There aren't many good tunes coming out nowadays.
ko: 요즘은 들을 만한 좋은 노래가 별로 안 나오네요.

en: As for the students of today, I don't know what they are thinking about.
ko: 요즘 학생들은 도대체 무슨 생각을 하는지 모르겠어요.

en: What kinds of sports do you go in for these days?
These days you can't walk down the street without seeing people dropping litter.
ko: 요즘은 길 가다 보면 쓰레기 버리는 사람들을 꼭 보게 되더라고요.

en: Boys have their own bikes these days.
ko: 요즘 애들은 다 자기 자전거가 있더라고요.

en: These days, the motives for marriage are not necessarily pure.
ko: 요즘은 결혼하려는 이유가 꼭 순수하지만은 않은 것 같아요.

en: I've been on edge recently.
Nowadays children do not play outdoors.
I hope to see you soon.
I'm looking forward to seeing you again before long.
The chill of coming winter discouraged our picnic.
ko: 겨울 추위가 다가오니까 소풍 갈 엄두가 안 나더라고요.

en: She has improved her skill in cooking recently.
ko: 그분 요즘 요리 솜씨가 부쩍 늘었어요.

en: I have not heard from her recently.
ko: 요즘 그 여자분 소식을 못 들었어요.

en: Nowadays his father goes to work by car.
I have seen little of him lately.
ko: 요즘 그 사람 얼굴 보기 힘들더라고요.

en: We have had bad weather recently.
Prices are high these days.
Meat is very expensive nowadays.
I haven't seen anything of her lately.
ko: 요즘 그 여자분 통 못 봤어요.

en: What do you make of his attitude towards us these days?
